current_fears: no one responding to their comment in a group discussion
voice shaking or stumbling over words during a conversation
being judged for a social misstep
current_challenges: hesitation to speak up in class discussions
fear of drawing attention to oneself
difficulty initiating casual conversations with peers
current_behaviors: choosing seats far from the instructor to avoid notice
looking down or away during interactions
exiting class quickly to avoid post-class socializing

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: fear of being ignored, saying wrong things, and looking foolish; challenges in joining group discussions, asking questions in class, and making small talk; behaviors like sitting in back and avoiding eye contact; triggers like large groups and new people. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: starting small by asking clarifying questions in stats class, saying a quick "hey" to a classmate, and recognizing that others are not analyzing their actions. 3) Student's response to solutions: positive, with plans to try the "hey" greeting the next day and ask a question in stats class next week. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: student broke down fears into manageable steps, acknowledged others' similar feelings, and committed to specific actions, showing reduced overwhelm and increased confidence.

fears_materialized.being ignored: saying hi to someone before class and fearing they won't respond
fears_materialized.saying wrong things: raising hand in class and worrying about giving an imperfect answer
fears_materialized.looking foolish: freezing up when trying to speak in class

challenges_materialized.joining group discussions: avoiding participation in stats class discussions
challenges_materialized.asking questions in class: hesitating to raise hand even for clarifying questions
challenges_materialized.making small talk: struggling to initiate a simple greeting with classmates

behaviors_detailed.sitting in back: choosing seats far from the professor to avoid attention
behaviors_detailed.avoiding eye contact: looking at notes instead of engaging with peers
behaviors_detailed.leaving early: exiting class quickly to avoid social interactions

triggers_specified.presentations: fear of being called on or speaking in front of class
triggers_specified.new people: approaching classmates for the first time

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Student's fear of speaking up in class, anxiety about being ignored or judged, and avoidance behaviors in social settings. Solutions offered/accepted: Starting with one sentence in class, practicing in a safe environment, and focusing on progress over perfection. Student's response to solutions: Positively engaged by practicing with AI Coach, successfully delivered a sentence, and showed reduced physical tension. Evidence of progress/improvement: Student agreed to try speaking up in next class, demonstrated ability to articulate thoughts clearly, and expressed a shift in mindset towards self-compassion and gradual improvement.

fears_materialized.being ignored: Holding back in psych seminar despite having a valid idea
fears_materialized.saying wrong things: Rehearsing thoughts but freezing when it's time to speak
fears_materialized.looking foolish: Fear of voice shaking or being too quiet when speaking up

challenges_materialized.joining group discussions: Not sharing thoughts in psych seminar
challenges_materialized.asking questions in class: Avoiding participation due to fear of judgment

behaviors_detailed.sitting in back: Choosing seats away from attention in class

triggers_specified.presentations: Fear of public speaking or being the center of attention
triggers_specified.new people: General discomfort in unfamiliar social settings

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Student's fear of speaking in class due to anxiety about judgment and freezing when called on. Solutions offered/accepted: Starting small with one sentence, asking for thinking time, and reframing nervousness as bravery. Student's response to solutions: Initially hesitant but engaged in role-playing, showed willingness to try, and experienced a moment of forgetting fear. Evidence of progress/improvement: Successfully articulated thoughts in role-play, recognized own capability, and requested further practice.

triggers_specified.new people: General avoidance of unfamiliar social settings

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: The student expressed fears of being ignored, saying wrong things, and looking foolish, particularly in group discussions and when meeting new people. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested starting with small, low-stakes interactions like giving compliments and reassured the student that most people are not judging them. The student agreed to try complimenting a classmate's notebook. 3) Student's response to solutions: Initially hesitant, the student warmed to the idea and identified a specific opportunity to practice. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: The student demonstrated willingness to take a small step, rationalized the low risk of failure, and planned a concrete action (complimenting the notebook).
